Tumbangnya Para Pesohor Hukum dalam Seleksi Calon Hakim Agung
06 Nov 2019, 08:22 by Andi Saputra
Jakarta - Komisi Yudisial (KY) hanya meloloskan 14 nama untuk masuk ke tahapan wawancara terbuka calon hakim agung. KY mencoret sejumlah nama pesohor para kampiun di dunia peradilan dan hukum.
"Kami tidak memiliki preferensi karier atau nonkarier, semua didasarkan tes yang objektif dan hasilnya seperti itu. Bisa berubah tiap tahun," kata Ketua Bidang Rekrutmen Hakim KY Aidul Fitriciada Azhari.
14 Nama yang lolos ke tahap selanjutnya adalah:
1. Ahmad Choiri (Ketua Pengadilan Tinggi Agama Samarinda)
2. Busra (Ketua Pengadilan Tinggi Agama Kupang).
3. Dwi Sugiarto (hakim tinggi Pengadilan Tinggi Denpasar)
4. Maryana (hakim tinggi Pengadilan Tinggi Yogyakarta)
5. Rahmi Mulyati (panitera muda perdata khusus MA)
6. Sumpeno (hakim tinggi Pengadilan Tinggi Denpasar).
7. Artha Theresia Silalahi (hakim tinggi Pengadilan Tinggi Pelambang)
8. Soesilo (hakim tinggi Pengadilan Tinggi Banjarmasin).
9. Kolonel Sus Reki Irene Lumme (hakim tinggi Badan Pengawasan MA)
10. Brigjen TNI Sugeng Sutrisno (hakim militer utama Dilmiltama)
12. Kolonel Tiarsen Buaton (dosen Sekolah Tinggi Hukum Militer Ditkumad).
13. Sartono (Wakil Ketua III Pengadilan Pajak Bidang Pembinaan dan Pengawasan Kinerja Hakim)
14. Triyono Martanto (hakim Pengadilan Pajak).
Lalu siapa saja yang terpental? Di antaranya yaitu Direktur Jenderal Penyelenggaraan Pos dan Informatika (PPI) Kementerian Komunkasi dan Informatika (Kominfo), Ahmad M. Ramli. Guru besar Universitas Padjadjaran (Unpad) Bandung itu juga pernah menjadi Dirjen Kekayaan Intelektual Kemenkum HAM.


Ahmad Ramli (dok.detikcom)

Tumbang pula Sekretaris MA, Achmad Setyo Pudjoharsoyo. Padahal, karier Pudjo cukup moncer. Setelah menjadi Ketua PN Jakbar, ia dilantik jadi hakim tinggi pada Pengadilan Tanjungkaran, Lampung. Belum sampai sepekan, ia langsung ditunjuk menjadi Sekretaris MA.
KY juga mencoret hakim Jhon Halasan Butarbutar. Saat menjadi hakim PN Jakpus, ia kerap bolak-balik muncul di media massa karena menjadi ketua majelis kasus e-KTP dengan terdakwa Andi Narogong, Irman dan Sugiharto. Kini ia hakim tinggi di PT Pontianak.
Ketua majelis konflik Partai Golkar, Lilik Mulyadi juga kandas. Saat menjadi Ketua PN Jakut, Lilik juga menjadi ketua majelis Agung Laksono vs Aburizal Bakrie dan Lilik memenangkan Aburizal Bakrie. Lilik juga menjadi ketua majelis kasus pembunuhan Yohannes Haerudy B Natong (Rudy) dengan terdakwa Adiguna Sutowo, anak kandung (alm) Ibnu Sutowo.
Pria kelahiran Bogor, 23 Agustus 1961 itu juga yang menghukum mati pelaku bom Bali, Amrozi cs. Kini Lilik sehari-hari mengajar di Balitbang Diklat Kumdil Mahkamah Agung.
Ada pula nama Prof Abdul Latief. Guru besar Universitas Muslim Indonesia (UMI) Makassar itu kini menjadi hakim spesialis mengadili perkara korupsi di tingkat kasasi. Sejumlah koruptor kelas kakap telah ia tangani. Namun, kariernya sempat terantuk KY saat mengadili Sudjiono Timan karena ia melepaskan terpidana korupsi BLBI senilai Rp 1 triliun lebih itu.
Kini, 14 nama yang lolos akan mengikuti tes wawancara terbuka yang digelar pekan depan. Setelah itu, KY akan memeras yang dinilai lolos menjadi hakim agung. Nama-nama itu kemudian akan disodorkan ke DPR untuk disetujui.

The Fall of the Legal Admirers in the Selection of Prospective Supreme Judges
Nov 6 2019, 08:22 by Andi Saputra
Jakarta - Judicial Commission (KY) only passed 14 names to enter the open interview stage of the prospective Chief Justice. KY crossed out a number of celebrity names of champions in the world of justice and law.
"We don't have career or non-career preferences, everything is based on objective tests and the results are like that. It can change every year," said Judge KY Aidul Fitriciada Chairman Azhari.
14 Names that pass to the next stage are:
1. Ahmad Choiri (Chair of Samarinda High Court of Religion)
2. Busra (Chair of the Kupang High Court of Religion).
3. Dwi Sugiarto (high judge of the Denpasar High Court)
4. Maryana (High Judge of the Yogyakarta High Court)
5. Rahmi Mulyati (young civil registrar specifically MA)
6. Sumpeno (high judge of the Denpasar High Court).
7. Artha Theresia Silalahi (High Judge of the Court of Appeal)
8. Soesilo (high judge of Banjarmasin High Court).
9. Colonel Sus Reki Irene Lumme (Supreme Judge of the Supreme Court Supervisory Agency)
10. Brigadier General Sugeng Sutrisno (main military judge Dilmiltama)
12. Colonel Tiarsen Buaton (lecturer at the Ditkumad Military Law School).
13. Sartono (Deputy Chair III of the Tax Court for Guiding and Supervising the Performance of Judges)
14. Triyono Martanto (judge of the Tax Court).
Then who is bouncing off? Among them were the Director General of Post and Information Technology (PPI) of the Ministry of Communication and Information Technology (Kominfo), Ahmad M. Ramli. The professor from Padjadjaran University (Unpad) in Bandung had also been the Director General of Intellectual Property at the Ministry of Law and Human Rights.


Ahmad Ramli (dok.detikcom)

Also uprooted MA Secretary, Achmad Setyo Pudjoharsoyo. In fact, Pudjo's career was quite outstanding. After becoming Chairman of the West Jakarta District Court, he was appointed high judge at the Tanjungkaran Court, Lampung. Not even a week ago, he was immediately appointed as Secretary of the Supreme Court.
KY also crossed out judge Jhon Halasan Butarbutar. When he was a judge at the Central Jakarta District Court, he frequently appeared in the mass media because he was the head of the e-KTP case panel with defendants Andi Narogong, Irman and Sugiharto. Now he is a high judge at PT Pontianak.
The head of the Golkar Party's conflict assembly, Lilik Mulyadi, also ran aground. When he was the Chairperson of the North Jakarta District Court, Lilik was also the chair of the Majlis Agung Laksono vs Aburizal Bakrie and Lilik won Aburizal Bakrie. Lilik was also the chair of the council for the murder of Yohannes Haerudy B Natong (Rudy) with the defendant Adiguna Sutowo, the biological son of the late Ibnu Sutowo.
The man born in Bogor, August 23, 1961 was also the one who sentenced the Bali bombers to death, Amrozi cs. Now, Lilik teaches daily at Baldbang, the Dikdil Training of the Supreme Court.
There is also the name of Prof. Abdul Latif. The professor at the Makassar Muslim University (UMI) in Makassar is now a specialist judge adjudicating corruption cases at the cassation level. He has dealt with a number of high-level corruptors. However, his career was stumbled by KY when he tried Sudjiono Timan because he released the BLBI convict for corruption worth more than Rp 1 trillion.
Now, 14 names that pass will take the open interview test which will be held next week. After that, KY will blackmail those who are judged to be qualified as justices. The names will then be presented to the DPR for approval.
